== Athletics ==

[[File:Umhb logo.png|thumb|right|Athletics logo]]
The UMHB Crusaders, or "The Cru," competes in [[NCAA]] [[Division III]] as a member of the [[American Southwest Conference]] (ASC). UMHB was formally a member of the [[National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics|NAIA]] before becoming a full member of the NCAA Division III following the 1999â2000 school year. UMHB held dual membership in the NAIA and NCAA during a provisional period as UMHB was transitioning to the NCAA.<ref name="Athletics">{{cite web|url=http://www.umhb.edu/athletics/about_us.html|title=About UMHB Athletics|accessdate=2008-05-20|publisher=UMHB Athletics}}</ref>
The UMHB Crusaders, or "The Cru," competes in [[NCAA]] [[Division III]] as a member of the [[American Southwest Conference]] (ASC). UMHB was formally a member of the [[National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics|NAIA]] before becoming a full member of the NCAA Division III following the 1999â2000 school year. UMHB held dual membership in the NAIA and NCAA during a provisional period as UMHB was transitioning to the NCAA.<ref name="Athletics">{{cite web|url=http://www.umhb.edu/athletics/about_us.html|title=About UMHB Athletics|accessdate=2008-05-20|publisher=UMHB Athletics}}</ref>
